titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Samuel Grant Oliphant (1864-1936) was a classics scholar who served on the faculties of Washington and Jefferson College, Parsons College, and Grove City College. He received bachelor's and master's degrees from Princeton University (1891 and 1894) and a Ph.D. from Johns Hopkins University (1904).

scopecontent.p: The collection contains a small amount of Oliphant's personal and professional papers. Materials include correspondence, printed materials from professional and leisure societies such as the American Philogical Society and the National Travel Club, insurance policies, stock certificates, reprints of articles by Oliphant, and notes.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Historical Society of Pennsylvania: various Oliphant genealogical collections; Johns Hopkins University: Samuel Grant Oliphant papers.
